}
dyn_link <- function(text,
                     base_url,
                     relative_url = "",
                     # Change to TRUE when admiral adopts multiversion docs
                     is_multiversion = FALSE,
                     multiversion_default_ref = "main") {
  url <- paste(base_url, relative_url, sep = "/")
  if (is_multiversion) {
    url <- paste(
      base_url,
      Sys.getenv("BRANCH_NAME", multiversion_default_ref),
      relative_url,
      sep = "/"
    )
  }
  return(link(text, url))
}

# Introduction

This article describes creating an `ADCE` ADaM. The currently  
presented example is tested using `CE`  SDTM domains and `ADSL` ADaM domain. However, other domains could be used if needed (eg `VS`).

**Note:** *All examples assume CDISC SDTM and/or ADaM format as input unless 
otherwise specified.*

# Programming Flow
* [Read in Data](#readdata)
* [Restrict CE to Reactogenicity](#cefilter)
* [Creation of Periods Reference dataset](#adperiods)
* [Derivation of Analysis Dates](#adates)
* [Join with the periods reference dataset](#mergeperiods)
* [Creation of analysis version for GRADING Variable](#agrade)
* [Creation of Analysis Sequence Number](#aseq)
* [Final Step : get all the remaining variables from ADSL](#jadsl)

## Read in Data {#readdata}
Assumption: The CE domain has already been merged with the SUPPCE dataset. If this is not yet the case, join SUPPCE onto parent CE domain using xxxx.

```{r, eval=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(admiraldev)
library(admiral)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(admiralvaccine)

data("ce")
data("admiralvaccine_adsl")

adsl <- admiralvaccine_adsl
ce <- ce

ce <- convert_blanks_to_na(ce)
adsl <- convert_blanks_to_na(adsl)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
dataset_vignette(
  adsl,
  display_vars = exprs(USUBJID,TRTSDT,TRTEDT,TRT01A,AP01SDT,AP01EDT,TRT02A,AP02SDT,AP02EDT )
)
```

## Restrict CE domain to the relevant records for Reactogenicity Analysis {#cefilter}
```{r eval=FALSE}
# Get CE records
ce01 <- ce %>%
  filter(CECAT == "REACTOGENICITY")
```

## Create Reference Dataset for Periods {#adperiods}
```{r eval=FALSE}

# Create period dataset - for joining period information onto ce records
# Need to remove datetime variables as otherwise causes duplicate issues
adsl2 <- adsl %>%
  select(-c(starts_with("AP") & ends_with("DTM")))

adperiods <- create_period_dataset(
  adsl2,
  new_vars = exprs(APERSDT = APxxSDT, APEREDT = APxxEDT)
)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
dataset_vignette(
  adperiods,
  display_vars = exprs(USUBJID,APERIOD,APERSDT,APEREDT)
)
```

## Select predecessor variables from ADSL, and derive analysis dates (ASTDT, ASTDY, ASTDTM, AENDT, AENDY, AENDTM) {#adates}

At this step, it may be useful to join ADSL to your CE domain. Only the ADSL variables used for derivations are selected at this step. The rest of the relevant ADSL variables would be added later.

```{r eval=FALSE}
# Get list of ADSL vars required for derivations
adsl_vars <- exprs(TRTSDT, TRTEDT)
# Derive analysis dates/days
ce02 <- ce01 %>%
  # join adsl to ce
  derive_vars_merged(
    dataset_add = adsl,
    new_vars = adsl_vars,
    by = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID)
  ) %>%
  ## Derive analysis start time ----
  derive_vars_dtm(
    dtc = CESTDTC,
    new_vars_prefix = "AST",
    highest_imputation = "M",
    min_dates = exprs(TRTSDT)
  ) %>%
  ## Derive analysis end time ----
  derive_vars_dtm(
    dtc = CEENDTC,
    new_vars_prefix = "AEN",
    highest_imputation = "M"
  ) %>%
  ## Derive analysis end/start date ----
  derive_vars_dtm_to_dt(exprs(ASTDTM, AENDTM)) %>%
  ## Derive analysis start relative day and  analysis end relative day ----
  derive_vars_dy(
    reference_date = TRTSDT,
    source_vars = exprs(ASTDT, AENDT)
  )

```


## Join with the periods reference dataset and derive Relative Day in Period {#mergeperiods}
Also add analysis version of CEDECOD and CEREL, ADECOD and AREL respectively.
```{r eval=FALSE}
ce03 <-
  derive_vars_joined(
    ce02,
    dataset_add = adperiods,
    by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID),
    filter_join = ASTDT >= APERSDT & ASTDT <= APEREDT
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    APERSTDY = as.integer(ASTDT - APERSDT) + 1,
    ADECOD = CEDECOD,
    AREL = CEREL
  )
```
##  Creation of analysis version for GRADING Variable (either TOXGR or SEV) {#agrade}
Depending on which variable is collected for the Grading (TOXGR or SEV) in CE domain, derive the associated analysis version.
In current example, TOXGR is collected, so the code is using this as an example.
In addition, derivation of Extreme Flags: example: flag the first occurence of the most severe grade within a Period.

```{r eval=FALSE}

ce03 <- ce03 %>%
  ## depending on collection of TOXGR or SEV in CE domain ----
  ## Analysis variant of ASEV and ASEVN ----
  mutate(
    ASEV = CESEV,
    ASEVN = as.integer(factor(ASEV,
      levels = c("MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE", "DEATH THREATENING")
    ))
  ) %>%
  ## Derive occurrence flags: first occurrence of most severe solicited AE ----
  ## - Company specific ----
  restrict_derivation(
    derivation = derive_var_extreme_flag,
    args = params(
      by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, APERIOD),
      order = exprs(desc(ASEVN), ASTDY, CEDECOD),
      new_var = AOCC01FL,
      mode = "first"
    ),
    filter = !is.na(APERIOD) & !is.na(ASEV)
  )
```
## Creation of Analysis Sequence Number {#aseq}
```{r eval=FALSE}
ce04 <-
  ## Derive ASEQ ----
  derive_var_obs_number(
    ce03,
    by_vars = exprs(USUBJID, APERIOD),
    order = exprs(ADECOD)
  ) %>%
  ## Derive analysis duration (value and unit) ----
  derive_vars_duration(
    new_var = ADURN,
    new_var_unit = ADURU,
    start_date = ASTDT,
    end_date = AENDT,
    in_unit = "days",
    out_unit = "days",
    add_one = TRUE,
    trunc_out = FALSE
  )
```

## Final Step : get all the remaining variables from ADSL {#jadsl}
```{r eval=FALSE}
# Join all ADSL with CE
adce <- ce04 %>%
  derive_vars_merged(
    dataset_add = select(adsl, !!!negate_vars(adsl_vars)),
    by_vars = exprs(STUDYID, USUBJID)
  ) 
```
